element.name: A Grand Cache by Hezekiah, Multi-cache (1.5/1)

center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

long-description.p: The stages in this multi-cache are all related to the "Grand" theme - as a landmark for those achieving their 1000th cache.
The coordinates at the top of the page will get you to the first stage, which contains the coords for the second stage. The second stage wil give the coords for the final cache.
This is an easy cache, but there's a bit of mileage involved! On a normal weekend day, it should take less than 3 hours to complete

element.encoded-hints: Stage 1 : Old gate - 2nd from left. Stage 2 : Could there be a sign round about here? Stage 3 : Now where else would you expect it to be??

ul.li:
2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by lenik1
Found it after a bit of searching with Sally+eL. TFTC

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by Sally&eL
17:56 #589
Finally, finished after two years!! Had the location of second stage for long time but took several attempts to locate the necessary info there. Could not leave Ireland without finding this one.
TFTC

2010-04-11T19:00:00Z : Write note by Blue Jay 59
Picked up part 1 today with Toffee Man - Grand looks as well today in the sunshine as it did when we had our wedding reception there 30 years ago in October coming. [:D] Blue Jay 59

2010-03-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by asylumrunner
Quick and easy. TFTC

2010-02-21T20:00:00Z : Write note by Spark_ie
Part 1 in the bag, clue wasn't quite correct, but it is there... Might be a while before I cycle to Stage two !!!!!! [:D] Thanks, Spark_ie

The stages in this multi-cache are all related to the "Grand" theme - as a landmark for those achieving their 1000th cache.

The coordinates at the top of the page will get you to the first stage, which contains the coords for the second stage. The second stage wil give the coords for the final cache.

This is an easy cache, but there's a bit of mileage involved! On a normal weekend day, it should take less than 3 hours to complete
